means: 打断( interrupt的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: A tap on the door interrupted him and Sally Pierce came in.
sentence.Network_cn: 敲门声打断了他，萨莉·皮尔斯走了进来。

sentence.Network_en: Rose's voice dropped and was interrupted by the rumble of Dagmar's.
sentence.Network_cn: 罗斯压低了声音，然后被达格玛低沉的声音打断了。

sentence.Network_en: He has rightly interrupted his holiday in Spain to return to London.
sentence.Network_cn: 他马上中止了在西班牙的度假回到伦敦。

encyclopedia.content: interrupted intə'rAptid形容词。动词interrupt的过去式和过去分词

entry.def: If you interrupt someone who is speaking, you say or do something that causes them to stop.

example.ex: Turkin tapped him on the shoulder. 'Sorry to interrupt, Colonel.'...
example.tran: 图尔金拍拍他的肩膀。“不好意思打断您一下,上校。”

example.ex: He tried to speak, but she interrupted him.
example.tran: 他想说话,但被她打断了。

entry.def: If someone or something interrupts a process or activity, they stop it for a period of time.

example.ex: He has rightly interrupted his holiday in Spain to return to London...
example.tran: 他马上中止了在西班牙的度假回到伦敦。

example.ex: The match took nearly three hours and was interrupted at times by rain.
example.tran: 比赛进行了将近3个小时,几次因雨而暂停。

entry.def: If something interrupts a line, surface, or view, it stops it from being continuous or makes it look irregular.

example.ex: Taller plants interrupt the views from the house.
example.tran: 稍高些的植物遮挡了房内的视线。

auth_sentence.content: Every time the therapist started to speak mom interrupted.
auth_sentence.res_content: Every time the therapist started to speak mom interrupted.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Every time the therapist started to speak mom interrupted.

auth_sentence.content: Steele was getting impatient, and he interrupted Marouf.
auth_sentence.res_content: Steele was getting impatient, and he interrupted Marouf.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Steele was getting impatient, and he interrupted Marouf.

auth_sentence.content: He is interrupted by a call on his radio.
auth_sentence.res_content: He is interrupted by a call on his radio.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He is interrupted by a call on his radio.

Sentence.sentence: He's about to commit suicide when he's interrupted by an old man who says his name is Smith.

The average amount of time students now take to complete an undergraduate degree has stretched to six years and seven months as students interrupted by work, inconvenienced by unavailable classes, or lured by one more football season find it hard to graduate.
